summary: Natural disasters in the U.S. have caused an average of almost $150 billion in damages per year over the past five years. These costs are likely to rise as the climate changes, creating a key source of federal fiscal exposure (see our High Risk List ). We testified that applying the 3 principles in our Disaster Resilience Framework—information, integration, and incentives—can help promote climate resilience...
title: Climate Resilience: Opportunities to Improve Federal Planning and Implementation
